intro: Redoutea tripartita, commonly known as the three-part redoutea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three parts, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
